qas.question: How many people go to see the Appalachian Mountains each year?
What part of the state are the Appalachian Mountains in?
Great Smoky mountain and Blue Ridge Parkway are located in what mountain range?
How many tourists visited the Smoky Mountains and Blue Ridge parkway in 2013?
What North Carolina City is consistently voted one of the top places to live in the United States?

context: Every year the <a2_0>Appalachian<a2_0/> Mountains attract <a0_0>several million<a0_0/> tourists to the <a1_0>Western<a1_0/> part of the state, including the historic Biltmore Estate. The scenic Blue Ridge Parkway and Great Smoky Mountains National Park are the two most visited national park and unit in the United States with <a3_0>over 25 million<a3_0/> visitors in 2013. The City of <a4_0>Asheville<a4_0/> is consistently voted as one of the top places to visit and live in the United States, known for its rich art deco architecture, mountain scenery and outdoor activities, and liberal and happy residents.
